channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple Shared Its First Public AI-Generated Image. It’s Craig Federighi’s Dog
item.description: Shared exclusively with WIRED, this Image Playground creation is the first that Apple has released outside of marketing materials.

item.title: Adam Neumann’s crypto comeback company is reportedly refunding investors
item.description: In a development that will surprise few, former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann’s climate/crypto/carbon-credit startup Flowcarbon appears to be in the process...

item.title: Apple Intelligence Promises Better AI Privacy. Here’s How It Actually Works
item.description: Private Cloud Compute is an entirely new kind of infrastructure that, Apple’s Craig Federighi tells WIRED, allows your personal data to be “hermetical...

item.title: Amazon starts testing ads in its Rufus chatbot
item.description: Rufus, Amazon’s recently launched, shopping-focused chatbot, is getting ads soon. That’s according to a changelog published by Amazon this week (first...

item.title: An AI Bot Named James Has My Old Local News Job
item.description: A local newspaper in Hawaii has turned to AI-generated presenters to draw in new audiences.

item.title: LineLeap lets users pay to skip the line at bars

item.title: No Dogs or Cats Were Harmed In the Making of This Post-Debate Podcast
item.description: WIRED unpacks last night's debate between former president Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs

item.title: Six-Word Sci-Fi: Stories Written by You
item.description: Here's this month's prompt, how to submit, and an illustrated archive of past favorites.

item.title: OpenAI reportedly in talks to raise at $150B valuation
